alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 10:01AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT PARTS OF OSWEGO AND LEWIS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 3 or more inches per hour. The heaviest rates are confined well inland across the Tug Hill. Rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are occurring elsewhere. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1000 AM EST, a lake effect snow band extended from Pulaski and Sandy Creek across the Tug Hill at Redfield, Osceola and eastward toward West Leyden. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Sandy Island Beach State Park, Pulaski, Redfield, Selkirk Shores State Park, Nine Mile Point, Mexico Point State Park, Richland, New Haven, Mexico, Williamstown, Orwell, Altmar, Osceola, West Leyden, Howardville, Salmon River Reservoir, Kasoag, Mohawk Hill, North Osceola and Swancott Mill. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 34 and 36. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. In some areas, the snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. &&
